revised_title: Avian Pulmonary Morphometric Parameters: A Comparative Study with Mammals
tldr: This study compares the pulmonary morphometric parameters of 42 bird species from ten orders with mammals, relating the comparisons to the varying biological needs of these avian taxa. The results show that birds have a more efficient pulmonary system than mammals, with higher surface area of the blood-gas barrier, greater pulmonary capillary blood volume, and higher morphometric pulmonary diffusing capacities. These adaptations help birds meet the high energetic demands of flight and other activities.
